bibliographic-data.invention-title: Hydrogen power, plasma, and reactor for lasing, and power conversion

document-id.name: SHEPARD JR VANCE R [US], et al
SHEPARD JR VANCE R [US], et al
GILLIGAN III THOMAS J, et al
GILLIGAN III THOMAS J, et al

abstract.p: Provided is an inverted population of hydrogen, formed from a novel catalytic reaction of hydrogen atoms to form lower-energy hydrogen. The inverted population of hydrogen is capable of lasing. The power may be utilized as laser light or the light due to stimulated or spontaneous emission may be converted to electricity with a photon-to-electric converter such as a photovoltaic cell.
